results.title: TV: behind the screen
results.creator_credit: Larry Stein, George McQuilkin and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Shows children how television shows are created by writers, editors and film crews. Reveals how special effects and dramatic productions are done. Introduces various television jobs.

results.title: TV news at the conferences
results.brief_description: This is a case study on British politics and television, shot during the 1976 Labour and Conservative Party conferences held in Blackpool and Brighton respectively. Concentrates on the way the BBC news covered three events of these conferences - the Prime Minister’s speech at the Labour Conference, and Mr Heath’s and Mrs Thatcher’s speeches at the Conservative Conference. Narrated by Michael Smee.

results.title: TV graphics: a training programme (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Muhip Babalik and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Outlines the main steps in the production of word captions, photo captions, simple animation for captions and other graphics for television. Good results are achieved not just by good layout and effective text but also by proper production techniques which ensure a good picture on the screen. Commentator: Tom Singleton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muhip Babalik and Centre for Educational Television Overseas

results.title: TV ads: our mini myths
results.creator_credit: Stanford Summers, Clio Enterprise and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Eleven prize-winning television commercials, grouped according to their persuasive intent, provide an entertaining and informative look into the business of advertising. From automobiles to insurance, from cameras to cologne, these vignettes illustrate the manner in which products are promoted all over the world. With no narration other than that contained in the commercials, each segment speaks for itself. Through imaginative animation and creative dramatisation, these messages accomplish their purpose by entertaining, educating, informing, using seductive overtones, etc. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Tusalava
results.brief_description: 1. Lye’s first film was originally accompanied by live music by Jack Ellit. No score was ever found, so the film presented here is silent, a vision of the beginnings of life on earth - mixing Maori, silent and modernist influences.

results.title: Turning point: rescue of a river
results.brief_description: History of citizen action for the protection of the Wilamet River in Oregon, U.S.A., and the current program - Project Foresight - for the preservation of open space and the limiting of urban sprawl so that both the Wilamet Valley and the Wilamet River remain free of cumulating industrial wastes and continue to be agriculturally fertile and productive
